greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = prime(n)^2 modulo prime(n+1).
comment: Only for three cases n = 4,9,30, a(n) < (prime(n+1)-prime(n))^2 because only in these cases (prime(n+1)-prime(n))^2 > prime(n+1):
In all other cases, a(n) = A076821(n) = (prime(n+1)-prime(n))^2, is highly probable but not proved conjecture.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A167770:=n->ithprime(n)^2 mod ithprime(n+1): seq(A167770(n), n=1..70); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 01 2014
xref: Cf. A076821 (squares of the differences between consecutive primes).
Cf. A001223 (modular square roots of this sequence).
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Nov 11 2009
